definition: commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: Commercial Invoice in three originals manually signed indicating contract number.
sentences.chinese: 手签的商业发票，三份原件，注明合同号。

sentences.english: Low Value shipments including samples should have commercial invoice attached to the shipment.
sentences.chinese: 低值货物包括样品应该开具商业发票，并附在货物上。

sentences.english: Commercial Invoice in five copies, stating contract number, L/C number and mark.
sentences.chinese: 商业发票一式五份，注明合同号，信用证号和唛头。

sentences.english: All taxes and charges will be charged at the issuing of the commercial invoice.
sentences.chinese: 所有的税费和费用按照开据的商业发票收取。

sentences.english: As requested, we are sending you herewith our commercial invoice in duplicate.
sentences.chinese: 按你方要求，随函寄去商业发票一式两份。

sentences.english: Three copies of Signed Commercial Invoice indicating contract number.
sentences.chinese: 签字的商业发票三份，注明合同号。

sentences.english: Commercial Values must have full description of contents and itemised values.
sentences.chinese: 商业发票中必须清晰显示快件的具体描述及单件价值。

definition: (international trade) documentation (e.g. a bill of lading)

pinyin: bu4 ke3 che4 xiao1 xin4 yong4 zheng4
